lead_paragraph: Moses Malone has joined the Philadelphia 76ers’ coaching staff as an assistant and will work primarily with the team’s power forwards and centers. Malone, 51, was a consultant for the team last season. He still holds the N.B.A. record for most career offensive rebounds. The 76ers also brought back Jim Lynam, their former coach and general manager, as an assistant on Maurice Cheeks’s staff. Lynam, 65, returned to Philadelphia as an assistant before the 2005-6 season but left the club during the preseason for undisclosed health reasons.
